oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Managing and Replacing Toxic Fescue
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lacefield, Garry
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: endophyte
tall fescue
toxin
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Research from many states has demonstrated conclusively that the endophyte is associated with quality problems in tall fescue. Interdisciplinary teams of researchers at different locations are presently engaged in studies attempting to provide answers to many of the remaining questions concerning the endophyte. A cause-effect relationship between the endophyte and a toxin has not been shown conclusively.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1986; 143-144
